derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English sti- (in stīfearh 'sty pig'), probably identical with stig 'hall' (see steward), of Germanic origin
early 17th cent.: from dialect styany, from styan (from Old English stīgend 'riser') + eye

entry.def: A sty is the same as a pigsty .

means.word_mean: 1. an infection of the sebaceous gland of the eyelid
